page.title: 01STAFFORD TOWN AND COUNTRY
page.content: Stafford is a typical small town which grew up within walls.The town centre has a fine Georgian house being used as the General Post Office,and the largest Elizabethan timber-framed house in England known as the High House.This is being extensively restored.The River Sow runs through a pleasant park.There is also a prison,and a railway station and a new recreation centre.Radiating out are streets of small late Victorian houses dating from about 1930.The main building of the General Electric Company-Stafford's biggest employer -is in this block,as are the new Stafford and District General Hospital and the Staffordshire Polytechnic. By contrast a large percentage of the block is taken up by several new housing estates and many acres of farmland.
